properties.prefix:
General Event


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the event being described. This is the primary way of naming this event in the system.
properties.title: Title

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the event in the context of your research.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of Alternate Title such as Abbreviation or Display Title.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: Alternate name, label or formal title of the entity being described in the record.
properties.title: Alternate Title

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the event.
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the event and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as IconClass or LC Subject terms. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the event in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the event for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the event, such as the name of a larger event or series of events of which the event being described was a part.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: The type of relationship such as Related Event.
properties.title: Relationship Type

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the event, such as general notes, historical notes, etc., and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: The type of note such as General or Historical, etc.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the event, such as the date it occurred, or the date it commemorated.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: The type of time period such as occurrence.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "the Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the event being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the time period being described.
properties.title: Time Period Notes

properties.description: Current or historical spatial location information about the event being described, such as place that is the subject of the event.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: The type of Place being described such as Event Location.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: The Geographic Coordinates for the place being described.
properties.title: Geographic Coordinates

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the place is relevant to the event.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of date related to the place.
properties.title: Place Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations which have a special relationship to the event. For example, the person who created it, or an organization which funded its creation.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of a person related to the event, such as “creator”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of an organization related to the event, such as “funder” or “sponsor”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: Information about the significance or setting of the event, such as religious or historical context or the surroundings of the event.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: The type of Context such as Historical or Religious.
properties.title: Context Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the context.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: Numeric description of the event such as number of participants.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are just a string of text. For example, L 15' x W 3'.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: A measurement intended to be a single dimension using a combination of the type, value and units fields.
properties.title: Numeric Measurements

properties.description: The type of measurement such as depth, circumference, length, width or height.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: The unit of measurement such as feet, inches, centimeters, etc.
properties.title: Measurement Unit

properties.description: The dates pertaining to a measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Dates

properties.description: The type of date related to the measurement.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A textual date related to the measurement, such as a time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century" or "the Mesazoic era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the measurement being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin date or End date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Notes
